00024 /** \brief A class representing the whole simulation region.
00025  *
00026  * The container class represents the whole simulation region. The
00027  * container constructor sets up the geometry and periodicity, and divides
00028  * the geometry into rectangular grid of blocks, each of which handles the
00029  * particles in a particular area. Routines exist for putting in particles,
00030  * importing particles from standard input, and carrying out Voronoi
00031  * calculations. */
00032 template<class r_option>
00033 class container_base {
00034         public:
00035                 container_base(fpoint xa,fpoint xb,fpoint ya,fpoint yb,fpoint za,fpoint zb,int xn,int yn,int zn,bool xper,bool yper,bool zper,int memi);
00036                 ~container_base();
00037                 void draw_particles(const char *filename);
00038                 void draw_particles();
00039                 void draw_particles(ostream &os);
00040                 void draw_particles_pov(const char *filename);
00041                 void draw_particles_pov();
00042                 void draw_particles_pov(ostream &os);
00043                 void import(istream &is);
00044                 inline void import();
00045                 inline void import(const char *filename);
00046                 void region_count();
00047                 void clear();
00048                 void draw_cells_gnuplot(const char *filename,fpoint xmin,fpoint xmax,fpoint ymin,fpoint ymax,fpoint zmin,fpoint zmax);
00049                 inline void draw_cells_gnuplot(const char *filename);
00050                 void draw_cells_pov(const char *filename,fpoint xmin,fpoint xmax,fpoint ymin,fpoint ymax,fpoint zmin,fpoint zmax);
00051                 inline void draw_cells_pov(const char *filename);
00052                 void store_cell_volumes(fpoint *bb);
00053                 fpoint packing_fraction(fpoint *bb,fpoint cx,fpoint cy,fpoint cz,fpoint r);
00054                 fpoint packing_fraction(fpoint *bb,fpoint xmin,fpoint xmax,fpoint ymin,fpoint ymax,fpoint zmin,fpoint zmax);
00055                 fpoint sum_cell_volumes();
00056                 void print_facet_information();
00057                 void compute_all_cells();
00058                 void count_all_faces(ostream &os);
00059                 void count_all_faces();
00060                 void count_all_faces(const char *filename);
00061                 void print_all(ostream &os);
00062                 void print_all();
00063                 void print_all(const char *filename);
00064                 void print_all_neighbor(ostream &os);
00065                 void print_all_neighbor();
00066                 void print_all_neighbor(const char *filename);
00067                 template<class n_option>
00068                 inline bool compute_cell_sphere(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,int i,int j,int k,int ijk,int s);
00069                 template<class n_option>
00070                 bool compute_cell_sphere(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,int i,int j,int k,int ijk,int s,fpoint x,fpoint y,fpoint z);
00071                 template<class n_option>
00072                 inline bool compute_cell(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,int i,int j,int k,int ijk,int s);
00073                 template<class n_option>
00074                 bool compute_cell(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,int i,int j,int k,int ijk,int s,fpoint x,fpoint y,fpoint z);
00075                 void put(int n,fpoint x,fpoint y,fpoint z);
00076                 void put(int n,fpoint x,fpoint y,fpoint z,fpoint r);
00077                 void add_wall(wall &w);
00078                 bool point_inside(fpoint x,fpoint y,fpoint z); 
00079                 bool point_inside_walls(fpoint x,fpoint y,fpoint z); 
00080         protected:
00081                 /** The minimum x coordinate of the container. */
00082                 const fpoint ax;
00083                 /** The maximum x coordinate of the container. */
00084                 const fpoint bx;
00085                 /** The minimum y coordinate of the container. */
00086                 const fpoint ay;
00087                 /** The maximum y coordinate of the container. */
00088                 const fpoint by;
00089                 /** The minimum z coordinate of the container. */
00090                 const fpoint az;
00091                 /** The maximum z coordinate of the container. */
00092                 const fpoint bz;
00093                 /** The inverse box length in the x direction, set to
00094                  * nx/(bx-ax). */
00095                 const fpoint xsp;
00096                 /** The inverse box length in the y direction, set to
00097                  * ny/(by-ay). */
00098                 const fpoint ysp;
00099                 /** The inverse box length in the z direction, set to
00100                  * nz/(bz-az). */
00101                 const fpoint zsp;
00102                 /** The number of boxes in the x direction. */
00103                 const int nx;
00104                 /** The number of boxes in the y direction. */
00105                 const int ny;
00106                 /** The number of boxes in the z direction. */
00107                 const int nz;
00108                 /** A constant, set to the value of nx multiplied by ny, which
00109                  * is used in the routines which step through boxes in
00110                  * sequence. */
00111                 const int nxy;
00112                 /** A constant, set to the value of nx*ny*nz, which is used in
00113                  * the routines which step through boxes in sequence. */
00114                 const int nxyz;
00115                 /** The number of boxes in the x direction for the searching mask. */
00116                 const int hx;
00117                 /** The number of boxes in the y direction for the searching mask. */
00118                 const int hy;
00119                 /** The number of boxes in the z direction for the searching mask. */
00120                 const int hz;
00121                 /** A constant, set to the value of hx multiplied by hy, which
00122                  * is used in the routines which step through mask boxes in
00123                  * sequence. */
00124                 const int hxy;
00125                 /** A constant, set to the value of hx*hy*hz, which is used in
00126                  * the routines which step through mask boxes in sequence. */
00127                 const int hxyz;
00128                 /** A boolean value that determines if the x coordinate in
00129                  * periodic or not. */
00130                 const bool xperiodic;
00131                 /** A boolean value that determines if the y coordinate in
00132                  * periodic or not. */
00133                 const bool yperiodic;
00134                 /** A boolean value that determines if the z coordinate in
00135                  * periodic or not. */
00136                 const bool zperiodic;
00137                 /** This array holds the number of particles within each
00138                  * computational box of the container. */
00139                 int *co;
00140                 /** This array holds the maximum amount of particle memory for
00141                  * each computational box of the container. If the number of
00142                  * particles in a particular box ever approaches this limit,
00143                  * more is allocated using the add_particle_memory() function.
00144                  */
00145                 int *mem;
00146                 /** This array holds the numerical IDs of each particle in each
00147                  * computational box. */
00148                 int **id;
00149                 /** This array is used as a mask. */
00150                 unsigned int *mask;
00151                 /** This array is used to store the list of blocks to test during
00152                  * the Voronoi cell computation. */
00153                 int *sl;
00154                 /** This sets the current value being used to mark tested blocks
00155                  * in the mask. */
00156                 unsigned int mv;
00157                 /** The position of the first element on the search list to be
00158                  * considered. */
00159                 int s_start;
00160                 /** The position of the last element on the search list to be
00161                  * considered. */
00162                 int s_end;
00163                 /** The current size of the search list. */
00164                 int s_size;
00165                 /** A two dimensional array holding particle positions. For the
00166                  * derived container_poly class, this also holds particle
00167                  * radii. */
00168                 fpoint **p;
00169                 /** This array holds pointers to any wall objects that have
00170                  * been added to the container. */
00171                 wall **walls;
00172                 /** The current number of wall objects, initially set to zero. */
00173                 int wall_number;
00174                 /** The current amount of memory allocated for walls. */
00175                 int current_wall_size;
00176                 /** This object contains all the functions for handling how
00177                  * the particle radii should be treated. If the template is
00178                  * instantiated with the radius_mono class, then this object
00179                  * contains mostly blank routines that do nothing to the
00180                  * cell computation, to compute the basic Voronoi diagram.
00181                  * If the template is instantiated with the radius_poly calls,
00182                  * then this object provides routines for modifying the
00183                  * Voronoi cell computation in order to create the radical
00184                  * Voronoi tessellation. */
00185                 r_option radius;
00186                 /** The amount of memory in the array structure for each
00187                  * particle. This is set to 3 when the basic class is
00188                  * initialized, so that the array holds (x,y,z) positions. If
00189                  * the container class is initialized as part of the derived
00190                  * class container_poly, then this is set to 4, to also hold
00191                  * the particle radii. */
00192                 int sz;
00193                 /** An array to hold the minimum distances associated with the
00194                  * worklists. This array is initialized during container
00195                  * construction, by the initialize_radii() routine. */
00196                 fpoint *mrad;
00197 
00198                 template<class n_option>
00199                 inline void print_all(ostream &os,voronoicell_base<n_option> &c);
00200                 template<class n_option>
00201                 inline bool initialize_voronoicell(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,fpoint x,fpoint y,fpoint z);
00202                 void add_particle_memory(int i);
00203                 void add_list_memory();
00204         private:
00205 #include "worklist.hh"
00206                 template<class n_option>
00207                 inline bool corner_test(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,fpoint xl,fpoint yl,fpoint zl,fpoint xh,fpoint yh,fpoint zh);
00208                 template<class n_option>
00209                 inline bool edge_x_test(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,fpoint x0,fpoint yl,fpoint zl,fpoint x1,fpoint yh,fpoint zh);
00210                 template<class n_option>
00211                 inline bool edge_y_test(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,fpoint xl,fpoint y0,fpoint zl,fpoint xh,fpoint y1,fpoint zh);
00212                 template<class n_option>
00213                 inline bool edge_z_test(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,fpoint xl,fpoint yl,fpoint z0,fpoint xh,fpoint yh,fpoint z1);
00214                 template<class n_option>
00215                 inline bool face_x_test(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,fpoint xl,fpoint y0,fpoint z0,fpoint y1,fpoint z1);
00216                 template<class n_option>
00217                 inline bool face_y_test(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,fpoint x0,fpoint yl,fpoint z0,fpoint x1,fpoint z1);
00218                 template<class n_option>
00219                 inline bool face_z_test(voronoicell_base<n_option> &c,fpoint x0,fpoint y0,fpoint zl,fpoint x1,fpoint y1);
00220                 inline void initialize_radii();
00221                 inline void compute_minimum(fpoint &minr,fpoint &xlo,fpoint &xhi,fpoint &ylo,fpoint &yhi,fpoint &zlo,fpoint &zhi,int ti,int tj,int tk);
00222                 inline bool compute_min_max_radius(int di,int dj,int dk,fpoint fx,fpoint fy,fpoint fz,fpoint gx,fpoint gy,fpoint gz,fpoint& crs,fpoint mrs);
00223                 friend class voropp_loop;
00224                 friend class radius_poly;
00225 };

00227 /** \brief A class encapsulating all routines specifically needed in
00228  * the standard Voronoi tessellation.
00229  *
00230  * This class encapsulates all the routines that are required for carrying out
00231  * a standard Voronoi tessellation that would be appropriate for a monodisperse
00232  * system. When the container class is instantiated using this class, all
00233  * information about particle radii is switched off. Since all these functions
00234  * are declared inline, there should be no loss of speed. */
00235 class radius_mono {
00236         public:
00237                 /** The number of floating point numbers allocated for each
00238                  * particle in the container, set to 3 for this case for the x,
00239                  * y, and z positions. */
00240                 const int mem_size;
00241                 /** This constructor sets a pointer back to the container class
00242                  * that created it, and initializes the mem_size constant to 3.
00243                  */
00244                 radius_mono(container_base<radius_mono> *icc) : mem_size(3), cc(icc) {};
00245                 inline void import(istream &is);
00246                 /** This is a blank placeholder function that does nothing. */
00247                 inline void store_radius(int i,int j,fpoint r) {};
00248                 /** This is a blank placeholder function that does nothing. */
00249                 inline void clear_max() {};
00250                 /** This is a blank placeholder function that does nothing. */
00251                 inline void init(int s,int i) {};
00252                 inline fpoint volume(int ijk,int s);
00253                 inline fpoint cutoff(fpoint lrs);
00254                 inline fpoint scale(fpoint rs,int t,int q);
00255                 /** This is a blank placeholder function that does nothing. */
00256                 inline void print(ostream &os,int ijk,int q) {};
00257                 inline void rad(ostream &os,int l,int c);
00258         private:        
00259                 container_base<radius_mono> *cc;
00260 };
00261 
00262 /** \brief A class encapsulating all routines specifically needed in the
00263  * Voronoi radical tessellation.
00264  *
00265  * This class encapsulates all the routines that are required for carrying out
00266  * the radical Voronoi tessellation that is appropriate for polydisperse sphere.
00267  * When the container class is instantiated with this class, information about particle
00268  * radii is switched on. */
00269 class radius_poly {
00270         public:
00271                 /** The number of floating point numbers allocated for each
00272                  * particle in the container, set to 4 for this case for the x,
00273                  * y, and z positions, plus the radius. */
00274                 const int mem_size;
00275                 /** This constructor sets a pointer back to the container class
00276                  * that created it, and initializes the mem_size constant to 4.
00277                  */
00278                 radius_poly(container_base<radius_poly> *icc) :
00279                         mem_size(4), cc(icc), max_radius(0) {};
00280                 inline void import(istream &is);
00281                 inline void store_radius(int i,int j,fpoint r);
00282                 inline void clear_max();
00283                 inline void init(int ijk,int s);
00284                 inline fpoint volume(int ijk,int s);
00285                 inline fpoint cutoff(fpoint lrs);
00286                 inline fpoint scale(fpoint rs,int t,int q);
00287                 inline void print(ostream &os,int ijk,int q);
00288                 inline void rad(ostream &os,int l,int c);
00289         private:        
00290                 container_base<radius_poly> *cc;
00291                 fpoint max_radius,crad,mul;
00292 };
00293 
00294 /** \brief A class to handle loops on regions of the container handling
00295  * non-periodic and periodic boundary conditions. 
00296  *
00297  * Many of the container routines require scanning over a rectangular sub-grid
00298  * of blocks, and the routines for handling this are stored in the voropp_loop
00299  * class. A voropp_loop class can first be initialized to either calculate the
00300  * subgrid which is within a distance r of a vector (vx,vy,vz), or a subgrid
00301  * corresponding to a rectangular box. The routine inc() can then be
00302  * successively called to step through all the blocks within this subgrid. 
00303  */
00304 class voropp_loop {
00305         public:
00306                 template<class r_option>
00307                 voropp_loop(container_base<r_option> *q);
00308                 inline int init(fpoint vx,fpoint vy,fpoint vz,fpoint r,fpoint &px,fpoint &py,fpoint &pz);
00309                 inline int init(fpoint xmin,fpoint xmax,fpoint ymin,fpoint ymax,fpoint zmin,fpoint zmax,fpoint &px,fpoint &py,fpoint &pz);
00310                 inline int inc(fpoint &px,fpoint &py,fpoint &pz);
00311                 /** The current block index in the x direction, referencing a
00312                  * real cell in the range 0 to nx-1. */
00313                 int ip;
00314                 /** The current block index in the y direction, referencing a
00315                  * real cell in the range 0 to ny-1. */
00316                 int jp;
00317                 /** The current block index in the z direction, referencing a
00318                  * real cell in the range 0 to nz-1. */
00319                 int kp;
00320         private:
00321                 int i,j,k,ai,bi,aj,bj,ak,bk,s;
00322                 int aip,ajp,akp,inc1,inc2;
00323                 inline int step_mod(int a,int b);
00324                 inline int step_div(int a,int b);
00325                 inline int step_int(fpoint a);
00326                 fpoint apx,apy,apz;
00327                 const fpoint sx,sy,sz,xsp,ysp,zsp,ax,ay,az;
00328                 const int nx,ny,nz,nxy,nxyz;
00329                 const bool xperiodic,yperiodic,zperiodic;
00330 };
00331 
00332 /** \brief Pure virtual class from which wall objects are derived.
00333  *
00334  * This is a pure virtual class for a generic wall object. A wall object
00335  * can be specified by deriving a new class from this and specifying the
00336  * functions.*/
00337 class wall {
00338         public:
00339                 virtual ~wall() {};
00340                 /** A pure virtual function for testing whether a point is
00341                  * inside the wall object. */
00342                 virtual bool point_inside(fpoint x,fpoint y,fpoint z) = 0;
00343                 /** A pure virtual function for cutting a cell without
00344                  * neighbor-tracking with a wall. */
00345                 virtual bool cut_cell(voronoicell_base<neighbor_none> &c,fpoint x,fpoint y,fpoint z) = 0;
00346                 /** A pure virtual function for cutting a cell with
00347                  * neighbor-tracking enabled with a wall. */
00348                 virtual bool cut_cell(voronoicell_base<neighbor_track> &c,fpoint x,fpoint y,fpoint z) = 0;
00349 };
00350 
00351 /** The basic container class. */
00352 typedef container_base<radius_mono> container;
00353 
00354 /** The polydisperse container class. */
00355 typedef container_base<radius_poly> container_poly;
00356 #endif
